title.narrative: F.a: Arauca: Prevention, Education on anti-personal mines and attention to victims

description.narrative: The project aims to improve the quality of life of landmine victims by strengthening their organization and capacity, to contribute to the implementation of a holistic action plan against landmines on communal, municipal and department levels and to raise awareness and preparedness of the inhabitants as to prevention of landmine accidents in the department of Arauca. Colombia is one of the most mine-affected countries in the world, and Arauca is the second most affected department in the country. Nearly all the accidents take place in rural areas and the majority of the victims is permanently disabled. By the end of the project landmine victims know their rights and how to claim them, they are organized and participate in decision-making about rehabilitation , health services and income generating activities in their communities, municipalities and departments. The people in Arauca know the risks connected to landmines and know how to be prepared. The program is implemented by the Lutheran World Federation/Dep artment of World Service
